description: This extension declares a group of concepts that is generated into the ValueSet.expansion.contains hierarchy when the expansion is generated for a UI. THere is no inherent assigned meaning to the hierarchy; it is used to help the user navigate the concepts. Each group has a display and/or a code, and a list of members, which are either concepts in the value set, or other groups (by code).

element.comment: Note that there are inter-relationships between concept status/properties and the way the groups are built; these are described and documented in the (value set hierarchical example)[d.html]. Note that this extension should be ignored when the expansion is not generated for UI.
element.definition: This extension declares a group of concepts that is generated into the ValueSet.expansion.contains hierarchy when the expansion is generated for a UI. THere is no inherent assigned meaning to the hierarchy; it is used to help the user navigate the concepts. Each group has a display and/or a code, and a list of members, which are either concepts in the value set, or other groups (by code).
element.short: Defines a hierarchy structure (when in UI mode)

element.comment: If there is no code, the group purely exists for display, and has no underlying meaning.
element.definition: A reference to a code from the include.system that defines the meaning associated with the group. Note that including the code in this extension does not include the code in the value set; if the code is intended to be in the value set, it must be listed directly as well.
The description for the group (goes in ValueSet.expansion.contains.dispaly). All groups need a display; this can only be omitted if there is a code that can be used to determine the display.

element.comment: A group without a code can be included by giving it an id and using #[id] in place of the code.
element.definition: One of more codes that identify codes in the expansion or other groups.
element.short: Codes or other groups in this group

name: expand-group

element.comment: Note that there are inter-relationships between concept status/properties and the way the groups are built; these are described and documented in the (value set hierarchical example)[d.html]. Note that this extension should be ignored when the expansion is not generated for UI.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: This extension declares a group of concepts that is generated into the ValueSet.expansion.contains hierarchy when the expansion is generated for a UI. THere is no inherent assigned meaning to the hierarchy; it is used to help the user navigate the concepts. Each group has a display and/or a code, and a list of members, which are either concepts in the value set, or other groups (by code).
element.short: Defines a hierarchy structure (when in UI mode)

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
